remarks: The product of a non-trivially converging infinite sequence is a complex number.  (Contributed by Scott Fenton, 18-Dec-2017.)
statement:
iprodcl.1 $e |- Z = ( ZZ>= ` M ) $.
iprodcl.2 $e |- ( ph -> M e. ZZ ) $.
iprodcl.3 $e |- ( ph -> E. n e. Z E. y ( y =/= 0 /\ seq n ( x. , F ) ~~> y ) ) $.
iprodcl.4 $e |- ( ( ph /\ k e. Z ) -> ( F ` k ) = A ) $.
iprodcl.5 $e |- ( ( ph /\ k e. Z ) -> A e. CC ) $.
iprodcl $p |- ( ph -> prod_ k e. Z A e. CC ) $.
$d A n y $.
$d F k n y $.
$d M k n y $.
$d Z k n y $.
$d k n ph y $.
